main event: A round object 10 times larger than the largest star was observed in Pittsfield, Maine, on 3 January 1956.
interesting points: The object had a red outer edge with a ragged appearance,The sighting lasted for about half an hour,The object exhibited erratic movements up and down and to the right and left,No sound or contrails were reported during the observation,The conclusion of the sighting suggests that it was probably astronomical.
